oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Lynn Anderson - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Lynn Anderson (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of August 22, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Lynn Anderson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Lynn Anderson Pulsebeat show -- (00:48) Spangler describes Anderson's early career, and Anderson reveals how few female country artists existed when she started -- (01:45) Spangler describes the success 'Rose Garden' brought Anderson; additionally, Anderson describes how it was lucky that 'Rose Garden' was not her first album -- (02:37) Rose Garden (Lynn Anderson) -- (05:15) Spangler performs an introduction to the commercial break -- (05:40) Spangler asks Anderson what influence Liz Anderson had on her songwriting -- (06:50) Didn't We Shine (Lynn Anderson) -- (10:02) Ron Olson and David Page discuss the news of the week including: T. G. Sheppard prospecting for gold and Billy Joe Royal -- (11:16) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (11:33) Spangler introduces Anderson to reflect on her new single -- (13:58) Under the Boardwalk (Lynn Anderson) -- (17:59) Spangler and Anderson reveal Anderson's passion to be horses -- (18:49) Top of the World (Lynn Anderson) -- (21:26) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (21:42) Spangler asks Anderson which track she wishes to hear -- (22:04) He's a Tramp (Peggy Lee) -- (24:03) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Anderson, Lynn, 1947-2015;
